E5A3687C51B34017B9ABFB7B48CFBF9E.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in manufacturing technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan, photographs of a project, technical drawings, reports, assignments), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

55B9D8CF57944A99AC8A7721CD9B0A70.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., teamwork, reliability, initiative);

38E5E0B8D9F946E596505ADEC18ACF16.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., decision making, job task planning and organizing, problem solving);

184CDBACA8E845198F3F974A4716CC7D.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the manufacturing industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

9C01CDA6BE2F435E8186B3F324F339D3.description: identify and describe the specific education and training requirements necessary for careers in the manufacturing industry (e.g., technician, technologist, millwright, tool and die maker, mechanical engineer);

20AE9527B94D43C0959E1AA01AB05C5D.description: identify employment opportunities available in the manufacturing industry locally, provincially, and nationally;

C1CA43C4A435410F99470F87E9FB4F01.description: Career Opportunities: demonstrate an understanding of postsecondary pathways that lead to career opportunities in the manufacturing industry

ABE973F4C7394FB895E11FFCBEA2BB90.description: use protective clothing and equipment as required to ensure their own and othersâ€™ safety in the work environment.

4C7CF07449054BE0A65D713B30C8713D.description: use proper ventilation and/or filtration systems to control air quality (e.g., to minimize the effects of welding fumes, plastic off-gassing, cutting-fluid misting, heat treating of metal);

3ACF0FFAAC4344F9A78FCC878E8390AA.description: demonstrate the safe use of tools and equipment in compliance with safety manuals, instructions, and institutional requirements;

F92F5D2F0F824408AAEFEAB0A9F0D7E5.description: demonstrate an understanding of procedures to ensure safe and productive work practices in the manufacturing workplace (e.g., perform safety inspections and audits that include ergonomic considerations related to workshop layout and set-up, material handling, ease of movement, lighting, workstation set-up);

03363B477F444CB5AFF79FC9C4D35FF3.description: handle materials safely and appropriately in compliance with the information included in the Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) from the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS);

6CF6D2D9D64B4479AC76DBC323FE5332.description: demonstrate good housekeeping practices in the work environment (e.g., cleaning up spills and leaks, keeping areas clean and clear of obstructions, properly organizing tools and equipment);

897B37C20FA14CD1B5A445272EF32CC2.description: identify and explain the importance of the specific components of legislation and standards related to workplace safety in the manufacturing industry (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS]) and the specific responsibilities of the relevant oversight/regulatory organizations (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB], Industrial Accident Prevention Association [IAPA]);

7326B6C8693141FA9D0320118F78535C.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and compliance with the health and safety legislation, standards, practices that are essential to the safe operation of a manufacturing facility;

DFDBB59B71154FBBBAAD30FB99F7CDEC.description: describe recent trends in the local manufacturing industry (e.g., globalization, rise in energy costs, increase in environmental awareness) and their effect on the local community or the province as a whole, and predict future trends.

342A5B8B71284DB68DA0938E2697F021.description: explain how the manufacturing industry affects the local and provincial economy (e.g., with respect to job creation, standards of living, sustainability and conservation of the environment, impact on First Nation communities);

E71F6F0B1D9A40E093075AD60135D2D8.description: describe the social and economic consequences that a manufacturing activity can have or has had on individuals and society, including Aboriginal communities;

ECD098A8BE304B2FBAB477A5D8B50EBD.description: Technology and Society: demonstrate an understanding of ways in which the manufacturing industry affects society.

1AFC8179C9524C91B0443C04F5F9E091.description: explain how various sources of power generation (e.g., coal, nuclear, wind, solar, geothermal) and transportation methods (e.g., truck, rail, ship) used in manufacturing affect the environment.

B7A6C0A2F44443D2BB67FEA6028ABA46.description: explain the benefits of using environmentally friendly processes and products in the manufacturing process;

122A5DBF642C47538F28F6258F841931.description: analyse the effects that various manufacturing activities have on the environment (e.g., the effects of waste disposal, power consumption, processing of raw materials; effects on Aboriginal hunting and gathering grounds);

84A6AB5268484BD5B71EFFA50F17AD15.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of ways in which the manufacturing industry affects the environment;

E61DF987EB7640B2850DED1E887FF4F5.description: explain how positive and negative attitudes influence production efficiency

A197F93E6C9343FEA41CBAB1A1A03385.description: use a quality control method (e.g., statistical process control) to monitor and record the reliability of a manufacturing process;

B7E413BB365D497FAEEB641A63BD682F.description: analyse and explain production results in a manufacturing process (e.g., by preparing a quality report);

6512EAB063434DC89F34465AC3EC07A3.description: Quality Assurance: analyse, properly operate, and maintain quality in a manufacturing system or process.

73DF84CFAAF649C6A2E2596BD3FEF422.description: use a computer to operate and control a manufacturing system (e.g., a robot, computer numerical control [CNC] equipment, a programmable logic control [PLC] device) during a manufacturing process or in the fabrication of a project.

B511F37CA7564CAA900DFDA67C4CAE6F.description: demonstrate the safe and proper use of appropriate hand tools, machine tools, and equipment (e.g., files, wrenches, hack saws, electric drills, engine lathe, milling machine, planer, jointer, drill press, welder) during a manufacturing process or in the assembly or fabrication of a product;

6DEB1CA6E12C42709795966787FBFFBE.description: demonstrate the proper use of various measuring instruments (e.g., scale, vernier caliper, micrometer), making measurements in both metric and US customary/British imperial units;

E933959FFCA8489CB4AED8A2ADFA4308.description: select and use the proper tools (e.g., height gauge, surface gauge, trammel points, protractor, scriber) and procedures required to effectively lay out a project;

3EBAE0D47BD849A790FF3A571DD2B95D.description: Tools, Equipment, and Manufacturing Processes: demonstrate the safe and appropriate use of tools and equipment in the manufacture of a product or the development of a production process;

5070C53E7BBE4EE995CF764F609440AC.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of the methods of conditioning materials (e.g., thermal, chemical, mechanical methods).

404DCE8A36BC4C6D863D818C3CE0B074.description: research and evaluate the properties of various ferrous and non-ferrous materials before selecting the most appropriate material for a project;

024992D292754C5D8528E319A98CD494.description: evaluate material properties (e.g., heat resistance, mass, strength) as they relate to specific project needs;

42D68A7365FD45AC87EC6C812BF5874A.description: demonstrate an understanding of destructive and non-destructive tests to evaluate material properties (e.g., file test, spark test, moisture content test, dye testing, hardness testing);

7123EBE5D25E41308C41D4BA82C3D485.description: Material Selection: demonstrate an understanding of the appropriate selection of materials to manufacture products to meet specific needs;

D3320B92B9E44B5CBA0FFE31AA4662A9.description: use appropriate orthographic and isometric drawing techniques (e.g., sketching, computeraided design [CAD]) when developing solutions to design problems or challenges.

112CEB2D500846408E81B49F0ABAE658.description: implement managerial and mechanical control plans for the manufacture of a product;

0FC2A2CA33394810AB471723FB8782F7.description: develop managerial and mechanical control plans (e.g., managerial: marketing, production tracking, financial control, inventory control, workin-process tracking; mechanical control: electrical, pneumatic) for the manufacture of a product (e.g., robot, control system);

A00DC8DE049540C783086B7BC96E2DE2.description: select the most efficient production method or process to manufacture a product;

C9729391816445BDBD9DCF4E5687F8D0.description: Managing the Manufacturing Process: identify and use appropriate processes to organize and control the manufacturing of products;

E7D297D6BC6F4924A6E2AB7C2B9D2155.description: prepare engineering reports (e.g., flow charts, inspection reports, tool lists, schedules, build plans), using appropriate technical language to communicate the specifics of a product or process.

279E71B4A94742F58EB8CCEAEAAC30DE.description: apply technological literacy skills to create process control charts that clearly outline the stages of production;

8B724C720CE7433B8C5141A20F86573B.description: apply scientific concepts to manufacturingrelated processes (e.g., material selection, material processing, setting of machining speed and cutting force);

D37D7E95F0394704B702EC3A57556026.description: apply mathematical skills (e.g., calculate production rates, machine speeds and feeds, ratios; use formulas related to geometry and trigonometry; estimate costs) in planning manufacturing processes;

E65B7DB914AD48338451801FA3FF1D24.description: utilize automation technology (e.g., programmable logic controller [PLC], computer-aided manufacturing [CAM], pneumatic actuators) to control a process.

D738BBADCB794EE98B9ACDEEAABCD395.description: explain how a quality control system (e.g., statistical process control, standards developed by the International Organization for Standardization [ISO]) is used to manage production;

BC792DDA2CE2418999D3B72E594E2204.description: incorporate the use of a control system (e.g., Program Evaluation and Review Technique [PERT] chart, Gantt chart) in a production process or project

6A5A322F254E4D6A8F33E2E345C7D4EF.description: describe various types of control systems (e.g., programmable logic control [PLC], computer numerical control [CNC], inventory/purchasing control)

1D1F6005686F455997B628D2603F13D0.description: Control Systems: demonstrate an understanding of various types of control systems used in manufacturing;

9B15B60FC2CD45F9AB8E944F98F19428.description: apply collaborative problem solving to plan a detailed product manufacturing process (e.g., including details of work flow, just-in-time part routing, scheduling, timelines, deadlines, efficient use of materials).

BF88EC8CC90D4B02BB440FF1DBEE99D8.description: explain the differences in planning for custombuild versus mass-production processes;

B2FC0C6F9A974DCAB0D83F972B9FFBC0.description: identify and analyse the factors that must be considered when planning production (e.g., quantity, tolerances, cost factors);

3244CB23DC49490CB37BADA41FECEADC.description: explain the need for a detailed production plan when manufacturing a product;

E3D413F0EE934465B4817EA3A60290BB.description: Process Planning: demonstrate an understanding of the steps and processes required to produce a product;

2052A946776D4E34AAE2E983E6646B77.description: explain how the application of technological concepts in design or other problem-solving processes can result in products that better meet human needs or wants (e.g., a ramp to replace a stairway, a lever-type door handle to replace a round knob, a remote control to operate a television, energy-efficient devices to replace inefficient ones).

3DE4E231469646209EA0A625BD750988.description: explain why technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, control, environmental sustainability/ stewardship, ergonomics, fabrication, function, innovation, material, mechanism, power and energy, structure, safety, systems) are important considerations in the design process

66947913F7E84996A3BDDBB0371BF860.description: use technical drawings (e.g., orthographic, pictorial, isometric, assembly) as part of the design process to develop solutions to challenges or problems in manufacturing technology;

E200FFF6B2FC49CCA0F8B7457804D07E.description: describe and explain the importance of the steps of a design process (e.g., analysing the situation or context, developing design criteria, generating ideas, conducting research, communicating ideas, choosing the best solution, building a prototype, testing and modifying the prototype, undertaking a cost analysis) or other problemsolving process used to solve a variety of manufacturing technology challenges (e.g., use a problem-solving matrix for a robotics-related challenge arising from the production of the prototype)

6E4C6FB18E8D4BF3A5D4AEC5F44F4811.description: Design Process: demonstrate an understanding of design and other problem-solving processes used to develop solutions and products in response to challenges in manufacturing technology
